characters: OF THE SEDAN, SHOVING IT SIDEWAYS AS AN ENDLESS TRAIN BAR
I WANT TO CREATE FOR MYSELF, NOT
LIMBO... ACROSS A WASTELAND... TWO ELDERLY HANDS CLUTCH E
A CURTAIN BILLOWS. MAL TURNS TO US, HAIR BLOWING, SMILING
BUILDING STARTS TO SLIDE DOWN THE MOUNTAIN-
RIOTERS POUR INTO THE ROOM, SWARMING OVER NASH... BUT NAS
IN THE BACK ARE DRAWN TO ONE SIDE OF THE VAN BY THE
OTHER SLEEPING MEN IN THE COMPARTMENT
THROUGH THE BROKEN WINDOWS FLOODING THE INTERIOR...
HE BREAKS THE SURFACE, GASPING FOR AIR IN THE BATHTUB IN
PULLS DEEPER OR FOR THE SURFACE, WE CAN'T TELL...
ALL THE WINDOWS, FLOODING THE ENTIRE HALL-
COBB IS SWAMPED BY WATER, SPUN IN ALL DIRECTIONS AT ONCE-
THE WATER, THE VAN CRUNCHING WITH THE IMPACT- WATER CRASH
YOU SAID WE'D GROW OLD TOGETHER
OTHER AS THEY LIE DOWN ON THE RAILROAD TRACK...
SLEEPING FACE IS WHIPPED BY THE SPRAY, AND WE-
"MY FATHER DOESN'T WANT ME TO BE
PAST, A WALL BETWEEN COBB AND THE AMBUSH-

dialogues.speaker: DAWN. CRASHING SURF.
dialogues.text: The waves TOSS a BEARDED MAN onto wet sand. He lies there A CHILD'S SHOUT makes him LIFT his head to see: a LITTLE BLONDE BOY crouching, back towards us, watching the tide a SANDCASTLE. A LITTLE BLONDE GIRL joins the boy. The Bea Man tries to call them, but they RUN OFF, FACES UNSEEN. H COLLAPSES. The barrel of a rifle ROLLS the Bearded Man onto his back JAPANESE SECURITY GUARD looks down at him, then calls up beach to a colleague leaning against a JEEP. Behind them cliff, and on top of that, a JAPANESE CASTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guard waits as an ATTENDANT speaks to an ELD JAPANESE MAN sitting at the dining table, back to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) He was delirious. But he asked for you by name. And... (to the Security Guard) Show him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) He was carrying nothing but this... He puts a HANDGUN on the table. The Elderly Man keeps eat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and this. The Security Guard places a SMALL PEWTER CONE alongside t gun. The Elderly Man STOPS eating. Picks up the cone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) Bring him here. And some food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elderly Man watches the Bearded Man WOLF down his foo He SLIDES the handgun down the table towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English) Are you here to kill me? The Bearded Man glances up at him, then back to his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elderly Japanese Man picks up the cone between thumb forefinger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what this is. He SPINS it onto a table- it CIRCLES gracefully across th polished ebony... a SPINNING TOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen one before. Many, many years ago... The Elderly Japanese Man STARES at the top mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It belonged to a man I met in a half-remembered dream... MOVE IN on the GRACEFULLY SPINNING TOP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man possessed of some radical notions... The Elderly Japanese Man STARES, remembering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the most resilient parasite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speaker, COBB, is 35, handsome, tailored. A young Japanese man, SAITO, eats as he listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bacteria? A virus? Cobb gestures at their feast with his wine glass-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An intestinal worm? Saito's fork pauses, mid-air. Cobb GRINS. A third man is the table- ARTHUR. He jumps in to save the pitch-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Mr. Cobb is trying to say-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An idea. Saito looks at Cobb, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resilient, highly contagious. Once an idea's taken hold in the brain it's almost impossible to eradicate. A person can cover it up, ignore it- but it stays there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But surely-to forget...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Information, yes. But an idea? Fully formed, understood? That sticks... (taps forehead) In there, somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For someone like you to steal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. In the dream state, conscious defenses are lowered and your thoughts become vulnerable to theft. It's called extraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Mr. Saito, we can train your subconscious to defend itself from even the most skilled extractor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I am the most skilled extractor. I know how to search your mind and find your secrets. I know the tricks, and I can teach them to your subconscious so that even when you're asleep, your guard is never down. Cobb leans forwards. Holding Saito's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I'm going to help you, you have to be completely open to me. I'll need to know my way around your thoughts better than your wife, your analyst, anyone. (gestures around) If this is a dream and you've got a safe full of secrets, I need to know what's in that safe. For this to work, you have to let me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito gives this a flicker of a smile. Rises. A BODYGUARD opens double doors which give onto a LAVISH PARTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. Enjoy your evening as I consider your proposal. They watch Saito leave. Arthur turns to Cobb, worried-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows. Cobb motions silence. A TREMOR starts, they steady their glasses, Cobb glances at his watch- THE SECOND HAND IS FROZEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on up there? And we-

dialogues.speaker: FILTHY BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Cobb, ASLEEP, SITTING IN A CHAIR AT THE END OF A STEAMING BATH. The chair is up on a cabinet- the bottom of the leg level with the rim of the tub. A sweating man (40's) watches over Cobb. This is NASH. A distant EXPLOSION rumbles through the room. Nash moves to window, parts the curtains. Outside: a CHAOTIC DEVELOPING CITY- the street filled with RIOTERS- SMASHING, BURNING. Nash checks Cobb's left wrist: above his watch, tape hold TWO THIN YELLOW TUBES in place. Nash looks at Cobb's watc THE SECOND HAND CRAWLS UNNATURALLY SLOWLY. Nash follows the tubes to a SILVER BRIEFCASE at Arthur's feet: ARTHUR IS ASLEEP in an armchair. Tubes connect the briefcase to Arthur's wrist. Nash follows another set of tubes from the briefcase to w they pass under the door to the bedroom. Through the crac the door, Nash sees SAITO ASLEEP on the bed, tubes runnin his wrist. BOOM- a closer EXPLOSION, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nash, ASLEEP. Head ROCKING AGAINST THE WINDOW as the trai BUMPS OVER A ROUGH PIECE OF TRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Japanese Man, TODASHI (18) watches Nash nervously. He checks Nash's wrist: TWO YELLOW TUBES CONNECT NASH WITH T

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SLEEPING MEN IN THE COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Todashi checks his watch: THE SECOND HAND TICKS IN REAL T Another TRAIN PASSES in the opposite direction with a MIG WHUMP- Todashi's eyes FLY to Nash's sleeping face- NASH JERKS WITH THE MOVEMENT OF THE TRAIN, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another EXPLOSION- Nash CHECKS the sleeping Cobb and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOW TREMOR RUMBLES THROUGH THE CASTLE. Cobb and Arthur steady themselves against the wooden rail. Several TILES pieces of MASONRY fall. Below them a BLACK SEA churns. Ot GUESTS wander the massive terraces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito knows. He's playing with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get it here. The information's in the safe- he looked right at it when I mentioned secrets. Arthur nods. Then spots someone over Cobb's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing here, Cobb? Cobb turns to see a beautiful woman, elegantly dressed, staring out at the sea. This is MAL. Cobb watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just get to your room. I'll take care of the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that you do. We're here to work. Arthur brushes past Mal, shaking his head. She nears Cobb Looks out at the DROP. The WIND WHIPS HER HAIR-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I jumped, would I survive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a clean dive, perhaps. Mal, why are you here? She turns to look at him. Amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might be missing me... She smiles. He leans in, mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. But I can't trust you anymore. She stares up at him, inviting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal sips champagne as she studies a painting by Francis Bacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like Arthur's taste. Cobb is looking down through the window at the GUARDS patrolling the castle at ground level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, Mr. Saito is partial to postwar British painters. He turns to Mal, donning a pair of black leather gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you sit down? Mal lowers herself gracefully into a leather wingback cha Cobb approaches, pulls out a length of BLACK ROPE and kne at Mal's feet. She looks down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me... Cobb TIES the rope around the CHAIR LEGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do the children miss me? Cobb pauses. He lets his gloved fingers lightly touch Mal ankle. He looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't imagine. Mal looks away, uncomfortable. Cobb gets to his feet, let out the rope as he moves back to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing? Cobb tosses the rope out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting some air. He tugs on the rope, testing. The weight of the chair, wi Mal on it, holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay seated. Please. And with that, he JUMPS. Mal considers the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb RAPPELS down the wall, darting past windows. He stop a particular one. Gets out a glass cutter- Suddenly he starts DROPPING-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EMPTY CHAIR SLIDES across the floor- WEDGES under the window-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb JOLTS to a stop 15 ft. lower. He looks up at the bed window. Shakes his head. Starts climbing back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb drops silently from the window into the darkened kitchen. He pulls a PISTOL from his belt, screwing a SILE onto the barrel as he GLIDES across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb SLIPS through the shadows towards a GUARD stationed the head of a GRAND STAIRCASE... The Guard HEARS something- TURNS- PEERS into the shadows. Cobb FLASHES out of the shadows, silenced pistol up, AIMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHHT- head shot- the Guard starts to drop... but Cobb is already there to CATCH him, sliding on his knees and lowe the Guard SILENTLY to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb moves to a PAINTING. With practiced hands he removes from the wall, revealing a SAFE. Cobb spins the dial, pul it OPEN, GRABS an envelope from within, stuffs it into hi waistband, where there is already an IDENTICAL ENVELOPE. LIGHTS COME ON. Cobb freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around. Cobb turns. At the far end of the room: Saito. Next to hi Mal, gun in hand. She smiles at Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun, Dom. Cobb doesn't move. Mal motions outside- two GUARDS drag Arthur into the room. Mal puts the gun to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Cobb slowly places his gun at his end of the long table, SLIDES it along the polished ebony. It comes to rest HALF down the length or the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the envelope, Mr. Cobb. Cobb reaches into his waistband, removes ONE of the envelopes, SLIDES it along the table. Steps back, hands raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she tell you, or have you known all along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you're here to steal from me? (beat) Or that we're actually asleep? Arthur gives Cobb an I-told-you-so look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know who your employer is. Mal COCKS the gun at Arthur's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No point threatening him in a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That depends on what you're threatening. Killing him would just wake him up... but pain? Pain is in the mind... Mal LOWERS the gun and SHOOTS Arthur in the leg- Arthur drops, SCREAMING- Mal looks at Cobb, cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, judging by the decor, we're in your mind, aren't we, Arthur? Cobb watches Arthur's PAIN. Mal aims at Arthur's other le Cobb SPRINGS for the table, SKIDDING along its polished surface- he GRABS his gun- SHOOTS ARTHUR BETWEEN THE EYES Arthur DROPS- the room starts to SHUDDER in a MASSIVE EARTHQUAKE- Cobb SPRINGS for the door- Arthur's eyes star the ceiling, DEAD, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur's EYES OPEN as he WAKES IN THE ARMCHAIR- he GRABS the tubes at his wrist, YANKING them free-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?! It's too soon- FLUID spurts from the tubes as Arthur STRUGGLES with the SILVER CASE on the bathroom floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! We have to reconnect the loop before they wake up! Arthur grabs the case and pushes through the door to the bedroom- following the tubes to where they meet Saito's w SAITO LIES ON THE BED ASLEEP. Saito STIRS and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb LURCHES towards the stairs, as all around him the building BUCKS and HEAVES-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito and the Guards PANIC. Mal walks calmly through the destruction, picks up the envelope and turns to Saito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was close. Very close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb runs up the stairs, pulling out the SECOND ENVELOPE-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito RIPS open the envelope, pulls out sheets of paper. looks at Mal, PANICKED. He turns to the Guards-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop him! Mal, confused, looks at the sheets of paper: THEY ARE BLA Mal smiles, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cobb runs up the stairs he reads the TYPEWRITTEN SHEET from his envelope, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur OPENS the silver case: a COMPLEX MECHANISM of TUBE SYRINGES, DOSAGE CONTROLLERS. Arthur's hands fly across t machine's controls as he glances at Saito's STIRRING face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to make it! Wake Cobb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nash turns to Cobb. Raises his hand and SMACKS him across face, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb is SMASHED sideways off his feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CEILING CRACKS above Saito- he looks up as a TON of S floods down, CRUSHING HIM and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito's eyes FLICKER OPEN. AWAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nash SMACKS Cobb again-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't wake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur crouched by Saito, connects the second tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunk him! A CLICK: Arthur looks up to find Saito with a gun to his and a finger to his lips, gesturing silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nash puts his hand on Cobb's forehead and PUSHES HIM BACKWARDS- as Cobb starts to FALL BACKWARDS in the chair are in SLOW MOTION, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, full speed, picks himself up, scrambling to read th last sheet of paper. He stares at it PUZZLED- bullets hit around him as the Guards race up the stairs and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb in SLOW MOTION, hits the WATER- head THRASHING as he goes under- and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb glances up from the paper as WATER EXPLODES IN THROU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb's AWAKE, GULPING AIR, getting his bearings. Saito SMASHES into the room, KNOCKING Nash down- Cobb LAUNCHES himself out of the tub, FLYING dripping wet acro the room to SLAM Saito against the door- the gun DROPS, Cobb's fist CONNECTS with Saito's jaw and the struggle is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, wet but composed, sits, turning Saito's gun in his hand. Nash holds Saito's arms behind him. Outside, the so of RIOTING grow louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came prepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bring the gun because not even my head of security knows this apartment. How did you find it? Arthur, at the window, looks out at the WORSENING VIOLENC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard for a man in your position to keep a love nest totally secret... particularly when there's a married woman involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She would never...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet, here we are. Saito is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a dilemma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got what you came for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite. The key piece of information wasn't there, was it, Mr. Saito?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur looks over at Cobb, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're getting closer, Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todashi slips a pair of HEADPHONES over Nash's ears, then pulls out an MP3 player and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito's eyes are on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You held something back because you knew what we were up to... Cobb uses the barrel of the gun to raise Saito's chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why let us in at all? Saito smiles, defiant. VIOLENT NOISES echo up the stairwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An audition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audition for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. You failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I extracted all the information you had in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your deception was readily apparent. And we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todashi opens the SILVER BRIEFCASE, revealing the complex mechanism of syringes and controllers- FOUR CONTROLLERS DISPLAY COUNTDOWNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todashi waits for the first countdown to hit "30," then H PLAY on the MP3 player- He watches Nash's sleeping face a RAISES the volume... Through Nash's headphones: the opening bars of Edith Piaf "Non, je ne regrette rien," and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distant background, strange MASSIVE low-end MUSICA start, sounding like DISTANT HORNS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So leave me and go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the corporation who hired us won't accept failure. We won't last two days... The DISTANT, SLOWED-DOWN MUSIC is becoming LOUDER, as are SHOUTS coming up the stairs. Arthur looks at his watch, i SLOW SECOND TICKING MARKS TIME WITH THE MASSIVE MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now I have to do this the old- fashioned way- Cobb GRABS SAITO AND PUTS HIS HEAD TO THE FLOOR, gun pres into his cheek. Saito looks into Cobb's eyes- sees he wil pull the trigger. Saito BLINKS, looks away in shame- When he NOTICES SOMETHING. And starts LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always hated this carpet. Cobb's eyes flick to the carpet and back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stained and frayed in such distinctive ways... Cobb looks up at Nash, who shrugs, at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But very definitely made of wool. Right now I'm lying on polyester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb glares at Nash, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todashi watches the first of the countdowns hit ZERO- He looks up at Arthur, STIRRING, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito turns from the carpet to look up at Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means I'm not lying on my carpet, in my apartment... (smiles) You've lived up to your reputation, Mr. Cobb... I'm still dreaming. Cobb looks over to Arthur, but ARTHUR HAS VANISHED, and w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur's eyes flicker open, AWAKE. He RIPS at his tubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good. Arthur checks the remaining three countdowns, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito gets to his feet, looking admiringly at Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dream within a dream-I'm impressed. Cobb lowers the gun. Defeated. Glances at his watch. The music REVERBERATES, the RIOTERS BANG ON THE DOOR, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur retracts the tubes into the case as he watches the next countdown hit ZERO, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another BANG on the door- Saito, confident now, approache Cobb. Nash is behind Saito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in my dream, we really ought to be playing by my rules...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes, but you see, Mr. Saito- Saito turns to Nash-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not in your dream- Saito turns back to Cobb, BUT COBB HAS VANISHED-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in mine. Saito SPINS back to Nash- the DOOR SMASHES OFF ITS HINGES

dialogues.speaker: RIOTERS POUR INTO THE ROOM, SWARMING OVER NASH... BUT NAS
dialogues.text: GONE. The music DIES. Saito and the rioters stand there i the SILENCE, the light DWINDLING... and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nash' eyes open, AWAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole! Nash BLINKS. Arthur is in his face, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you get the carpet wrong?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't my fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the architect-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know he was going to rub his damn cheek on it! Cobb pulls Arthur away from Nash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you-what the hell was all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had it under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd hate to see out of control-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no time for this-I'm getting off at Kyoto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? He's not gonna search every compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stand trains. Arthur moves to the briefcase. Turns a dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can keep him under for one minute- Arthur hits a button- A PLUNGER DEPRESSES. Cobb RIPS the off Saito's wrist, ROLLS up his tubes. Arthur SLAMS the silver case shut. Todashi pulls open the door-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every man for himself. Arthur and Nash EXIT, heading in different directions dow the corridor. Cobb hands Todashi a thick roll of CASH, lo at Saito, who stirs. Cobb moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BULLET TRAIN speeds through the lush landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito WAKES GENTLY. Looks around the compartment, empty b for Todashi, reading a comic. Saito looks down at his wri Sees a small mark. Rubs it. SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving over the vast city towards a high rise. A HELICOPT thumps into frame, heading for a pad on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb sits, waiting. Checks his watch, restless. He pulls HANDGUN. Checks it is loaded. places it on the table in f of him. Pulls out a PEWTER SPINNING TOP, SPINS it on the table ... He INTENT STUDIES the top's spin... As he stare the sound of a FREIGHT TRAIN builds and builds- the top WOBBLES, TIPS onto its side- the sound of the train STOPS the PHONE RINGS- Cobb GRABS it- CHILDREN'S VOICES (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Daddy! Hi, Dad. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. How are you? CHILDREN'S VOICES (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Okay, I guess. Cobb closes his eyes, trying to picture his children: INS CUT: COBB's MEMORY- a LITTLE BLONDE BOY (3), back towards crouches IN A GARDEN, looks at something in the grass... COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's just okay? Was that James? JAMES (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. When are you coming home? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. Not for a while. INSERT CUT: A LITTLE BLONDE GIRL (5), also FACE UNSEEN, j JAMES, CROUCHING BESIDE HIM... JAMES (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, James, like I've told you-I'm away because I'm working... LITTLE GIRL (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma says you're never coming back. Cobb pauses. Takes a breath. INSERT CUT: James and Philip FACES UNSEEN, lift their heads from the grass, responding someone's call- they RUN AWAY FROM US ACROSS THE GARDEN..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philippa, can you ask Grandma to pick up the phone- PHILIPPA (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's shaking her head. Cobb TENSES, as if about to SMASH the phone. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll just have to hope Grandma's wrong about that won't we? JAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Daddy? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? JAMES (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Mommy with you? Cobb looks like he just got punched- INSERT CUT: COBB'S MEMORY- MAL, WIND BLOWING HER HAIR, SMILES CALMLY... COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, we talked about this, James. Mommy's gone. JAMES (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? GRANDMA'S VOICE (over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go, kids. Say bye-bye- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give some presents to Grandpa, okay? Just be good for- Cobb STARES at the dead phone. Then DOWNS his drink- A KN at the door. Cobb GRABS the top, the gun- MOVES to the do cracks it: Arthur. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our ride's on the roof. Cobb nods. Moves to pick up his bag. Arthur watches. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb... are you okay? Cobb looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down in the dream... Mal showing up like that ... COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm sorry about your leg. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting worse, isn't it? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One apology's all you're getting, Arthur. Now, where's Nash? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't shown. Wanna wait? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) We were supposed to deliver Saito's expansion plans to Cobol Engineering two hours ago. By now they know we failed. Time to disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb and Arthur head towards the elevator. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where will you go? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buenos Aires. I can lie low there. Maybe sniff out a job when things quiet down. You? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stateside. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistful) ) 'Course. Send my regards. Arthur looks at Cobb. Nods. Sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HELICOPTER sits, ROTORS SPINNING. As Cobb and Arthur reach the door, it SLIDES OPEN. Cobb steps up into the leather-padded interior. He freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nash, BEATEN BLOODY, sits on the far side, slumped agains the wine. Beside him: SAITO. He nods politely at Cobb. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sold you out. Thought to come to me and bargain for his life... Saito's BODYGUARD offers Cobb a GUN. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I offer you the satisfaction. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how I deal with things. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you work with him again? Cobb shakes his head. Saito's BODYGUARDS PULL Nash from t chopper. Saito motions Cobb and Arthur to sit. The choppe RISES. Cobb watches Nash DRAGGED across the pad. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you do to him? SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. But I can't speak for your friends from Cobol Engineering. Saito looks out at the city slipping by. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from us? SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inception. Arthur raises his eyebrows. Cobb is poker-faced. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can steal an idea from someone's mind, why can't you plant one there instead? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's planting an idea: I say to you, "Don't think about elephants." (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Saito nods) What are you thinking about? SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elephants. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. But it's not your idea because you know I gave it to you. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could plant it subconsciously- ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The subject's mind can always trace the genesis of the idea. True inspiration is impossible to fake. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it isn't. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do it? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't do it. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In exchange, I'll give you the information you were paid to steal. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you giving me a choice? Because I can find my own way to square things with Cobol. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you do have a choice. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I choose to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter sets down next to a PRIVATE JET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito indicates the plane. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the crew where you want to go, they'll file the plan en route. Cobb and Arthur look at each other. Then move for the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Cobb...? There is one other thing I could offer you. (Cobb stops) How would you like to go home? To America. To your children. Cobb turns back to Saito. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't fix that. Nobody could. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like inception. Cobb considers this. Arthur touches his arm. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, come on- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How complex is the idea? SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple enough. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea's simple when you have to plant it in someone else's mind. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My main competitor is an old man in poor health. His son will soon inherit control of the corporation. I need him to decide to break up his father's empire. Against his own self-interest. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, we should walk away from this. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were to do it. If I could do it... how do I know you can deliver? SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't. But I can. So do you want to take a leap of faith, or become an old man, filled with regret, waiting to die alone? Cobb looks at Saito. Barely nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assemble your team, Mr. Cobb. And choose your people more wisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb reclines his seat. Arthur picks at a salad, angry. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how much you want to go home- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharp) No, you don't. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this can't be done. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can. You just have to go deep enough. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that!- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done it before. Arthur is taken aback. Cobb turns to the window. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it work? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Yes. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did you do it to? Cobb looks at Arthur. Closed. Arthur shrugs. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are we headed to Paris? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to need a new architect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, carrying a shopping bag, looks into a lecture hall: students, just a RUMPLED PROFESSOR hunched over paperwork

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never did like your office. PROFESSOR MILES looks up, squinting. Recognizes Cobb. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No space to think in that broom cupboard. Cobb steps down past the empty wooden rows. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it safe for you to be here? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extradition between France and the U.S. is a bureaucratic nightmare. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they'd find a way to make it work in your case. Cobb hand Miles the shopping bag. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you take these back for the kids? MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take more than the occasional stuffed animal to convince those children they still have a father. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I thought you could talk to Marie about bringing them on vacation. Somewhere I could meet- MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would she listen to me? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were married for twenty years. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blames me as much as you. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't she understand that my kids need me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she does. We all do. Go back and face the music, Dom. Explain what Mal did. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be realistic, Stephen. They'd never understand- they'd lock me up and throwaway the key. Or worse. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think what you're doing now is helping your case? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawyers don't pay for themselves. This is what I have. This is what you taught me. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never taught you to be a thief. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you taught me to navigate other people's minds. But after what happened with Mal there weren't a whole lot of legitimate ways for me to use that skill. Miles looks at Cobb. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come here, Dom? Cobb shifts slightly. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found a way home. A job. For powerful people. If I pull it off, I can get back to my family. But I need help. Miles realizes something. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. You're here to corrupt one of my brightest and best. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have someone good enough, you have to let them decide for themselves. You know what I'm offering- MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not just money: the chance to build cathedrals, entire cities- things that have never existed, things that couldn't exist in the real world... MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody dreams, Cobb. Architects are supposed to make those dreams real. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what you used to say. You told me that in the real world I'd be building attic conversions and gas stations. You said that if I mastered the dream-share I'd have a whole new way of creating and showing people my creations. You told me it would free me. Miles looks at Cobb, sad. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm sorry. I was wrong. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you weren't. Your vision was a vision of pure creativity. It's where we took it that was wrong. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you want me to let someone else follow you into fantasy. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't actually come on the job, they'll just design the levels and teach them to the dreamers. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Design them yourself. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal won't let me. Miles looks at Cobb. Appalled. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back to reality, Dom. Please. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know what's real, Stephen? Your grandchildren waiting for their dad to come back. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This job-this last job-is how I get there. Miles looks down, fiddles with his papers. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be standing here if there were any other way. I can get home. But I need an architect who's as good as I was. Miles looks Cobb in the eye. Decides. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got someone better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles and Cobb stand by as STUDENTS file out of a lecture MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne... A young woman carrying books turns. This is ARIADNE. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to meet Mr. Cobb. She sizes him up with quick eyes. Offers her hand. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you. MILES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have a few moments, Mr. Cobb has a job offer to discuss with you. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A work placement? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne leans against the parapet, overlooking Paris. She unwraps a sandwich, watching Cobb pull out a pad of GRAPH PAPER and a PEN. He offers them. She bites her sandwich. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Aren't you going to tell me anything? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I describe the job, I have to know you could do it. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not, strictly speaking, legal. Ariadne raises her eyebrows. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have two minutes to draw a maze that takes me one minute to solve. Ariadne takes the pad and pen. Cobb looks at his watch. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. She starts DRAWING LINES on the grid, constructing a maze COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Ariadne hands the pad and pen to Cobb. He glances at the then, looking her in the eye, TRACES the solution. She is taken aback. Cobb RIPS off the sheet, hands the pad back. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again. She traces straight lines, CONCENTRATING... COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. She hands Cobb the pad, a touch pleased. Cobb solves the puzzle instantly, as before. Her smile falls. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to- She GRABS the pad, frustrated... but this time she FLIPS over and starts drawing on the BLANK CARDBOARD of the bac Cobb watches, surprised. He smiles as he sees that she's drawing CIRCLES, creating a maze based on concentric ring Ariadne hands back the pad, defiant. Cobb takes the pen, starts the maze. This time he gets stuck. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (working the maze) More like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur stops at a warehouse door. Consults a piece of pap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, dusty warehouse. The SLIDING DOOR cracks open. Arthur enters. Looks around, approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur DRAGS LAWN CHAIRS into the middle of the room. He erects a table. Lays out several SILVER CASES, unpacking them, laying out lines of tubing, MECHANISMS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb and Ariadne sit at an outdoor table. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say we only use a fraction of the true potential of our brains... but they're talking about when we're awake. While we dream, the mind performs wonders. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you imagine a building? You consciously create each aspect, puzzling over it in stages... But sometimes, when your imagination flies- ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm discovering it. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Genuine inspiration. Cobb leans forwards and draws on the paper table cloth. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a dream your mind continuously does that... Cobb has drawn a circle made of two arrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It creates and perceives a world simultaneously. So well that you don't feel your brain doing the creating. That's why we can short- circuit the process... ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By taking over the creating part. Cobb draws a straight line between the two arrows. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where you come in. You build the world of the dream. We take the subject into that dream, and let him ВЈ111 it with his subconscious ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But are you trying to fool him that the dream is actually real life? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) While we're in there, We don't want him to realize he's dreaming. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I ever get enough detail to Convince him that it's real? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our dreams reel real while we're in them. It's only when we wake up we realize things were strange, Ariadne gestures around them- ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But all the textures of real life- the stone, the fabric. cars... people... your mind can't create all this. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does. Every time you dream. Let me ask you a question: You never remember the beginning of your dreams, do you? You just turn up in the middle of what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... how did we end up at this restaurant? ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came here from... Ariadne trails off, confused. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did we get here? Where are we? Ariadne THINKS, unable to remember. A FAINT RUMBLE begins ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. We're dreaming. Cobb nods. The RUMBLE is BUILDING. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay calm. We're actually asleep in the workshop. This is your first lesson in shared dreaming, remember? Ariadne looks around, mind REELING. Cobb BRACES- The restaurant VIOLENTLY FRAGMENTS, EXPLODING AND IMPLODI PARTICLES OF FURNITURE, WALLS, PEOPLE FLYING AROUND- Aria WONDERS at the MAYHEM WHIRLING around them- Cobb SHIELDS head against the debris. She sees him- ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over noise) If it's just a dream, why are you covering your- Ariadne is WIPED FROM HER SEAT BY A MASSIVE BLAST and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne JOLTS awake. COBB (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's never just a dream. Ariadne turns to Cobb's voice. They are both sitting in t lawn chairs. Arthur watches over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a face full of glass hurts like hell, doesn't it? While we're in it, it's real. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why the military developed dream sharing-a training program where soldiers could strangle, stab and shoot each other, then wake up. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did architects get involved? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone had to design the dreams. (to Arthur) Let's go another five minutes- ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were only asleep for five minutes? We talked for an hour at least... COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you dream, your mind functions more quickly, so time seems to pass more slowly. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes in the real world gives you an hour in the dream. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see how much trouble you can cause in five minutes. And we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne walks down the crowded street with Cobb. Cobb loo around at the street, the cafe, approving. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good. You've got the cafe, the layout... you forgot the book shop but pretty much everything else is here. Ariadne looks at the passers-by. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are the people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're projections of my subconscious. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yours? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure-you are the dreamer, I am the subject. My subconscious populates your world. That's one way we get at a subject's thoughts-his mind creates the people, so we can literally talk to his subconscious. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How else do you do it? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Architecture. Build a bank vault or a jail, something secure, and the subject's mind will fill it with information he's trying to protect. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you break in and steal it. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Ariadne wonders at the detail of the street. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love the concrete sense of things- (stamps foot) Real weight, you know? I thought a dream space would be all about the visual, but it's the feel of things. Question is, what happens as you start to mess with physics... She CONCENTRATES on the street. The street starts to BEND HALF- the buildings on either side FOLDING IN until they the INSIDE OF A CUBE OF CITY, GRAVITY FUNCTIONING INDEPENDENTLY ON EACH PLANE. Ariadne looks up (or down) a the people on the opposite city surface. Cobb watches her excitement. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's something, isn't it? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Yes. It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk, Ariadne notices more and more of the projections STARING at her. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are they looking at me? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're changing things. My subconscious feels that someone else is creating the world. The more you change things, the quicker the projections converge on you. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Converge? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They feel the foreign nature of the dreamer, and attack-like white blood cells fighting an infection. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to attack us? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just you, actually. They walk along the street to where it joins the next gravitational plane. They step up onto the different plan and walk down the street towards a river. As Ariadne approaches, steps emerge from the flagstone, and she lead Cobb up onto a small jetty. As she concentrates, pillars emerge and a BRIDGE starts to telescope out from the jett They step onto it as it grows. Cobb is impressed. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful... but if you keep on changing things... People crossing the bridge STARE at Ariadne. Several of t BUMP her shoulder as they pass. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind telling your subconscious to take it easy? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why it's called subconscious. I don't control it. The bridge now spans the Seine. Cobb marvels at it. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arched stone, iron pillars... it's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb pauses, thinking. Remembering. INSERT CUT: Mal, hair blowing, turns to Cobb, smiling, laughing. He smiles back. They are on the same bridge. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this bridge. This place is real- (serious) You didn't imagine it, you remembered it... ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I cross it every day on my way to the college. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never recreate places from your memory. Always imagine new places. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to draw from what you know- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tense) Use pieces-a streetlamp, phonebooths, a type of brick-not whole areas. Several people around them ECHO Cobb's attitude... ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because building dreams out of your own memories is the surest way to lose your grip on what's real and what's a dream. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did that happen to you? Cobb says nothing. He stands there, starinq at Ariadne. PEOPLE around her stop and look at her, hostile. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this isn't about me- Cobb reaches for Ariadne's arm, turns her to him- ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you need me to build your dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A passerby GRABS Ariadne's shoulder- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone- More of the crowd join in, PULLING at Ariadne, holding he arms open- Cobb PULLS people off- the crowd PUSHES him aw Cobb sees someone WALKING PURPOSEFULLY through the crowd towards the helpless, Ariadne- it is Mal. She approaches even strides- Ariadne stares at her, uneasy. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake me up, Cobb. As Mal walks, she pulls out a LARGE KNIFE- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal, no! ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake me up! Ariadne SCREAMS as Mal LUNGES at her with the knife and w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne WAKES, BREATHING HARD. Arthur moves to her- ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why couldn't I wake? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way to wake from inside the dream is to die. Cobb, in the lawn chair opposite, PULLS his tubes out. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll need a totem. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kind of personal icon. A small object that you can always have with you, and that no one else knows, Cobb gets to his feet, Ariadne stares at him, furious. He heads to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's some subconscious you've got, Cobb. (calls after him) She's a real charmer! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you've met Mrs. Cobb. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) She's his wife? Arthur nods, pulling off Ariadne's tubes. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. A totem. You need something small, potentially heavy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb takes out his PEWTER SPINNING TOP, SPINS it on the marble counter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne looks at Arthur, puzzled. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a coin? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too common. You need something that has a weight or movement that only you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb STUDIES the spin of the top as it decays, becoming m and more ECCENTRIC...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's yours? Arthur holds out a DIE. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loaded die. Ariadne reaches for it- Arthur snatches sit away-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you handle it. That's the point. No one else can know the weight or balance of it. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when you examine your totem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb's spinning top WOBBLES OVER. ARTHUR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, beyond a doubt, that you're not in someone else's dream. Cobb GRABS it like a drowning man reaching for a lifeline

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne thinks this over. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not an issue for me. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur, maybe you can't see what's going on, maybe you don't want to. But Cobb's got problems he's tried to bury down there. I'm not going to open my mind to someone like that. Ariadne gets to her feet. Walks away. COBB (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be back. Arthur turns. Cobb is standing in the bathroom doorway. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen anyone pick it up so fast. And one reality won't be enough for her now. When she comes back, get her building mazes. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where will you be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to talk to Eames. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames? But he's in Mombasa. Cobol's backyard. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Necessary risk. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are plenty of other thieves. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't just need a thief. We need a forger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowded, bustling, smoke-filled. a westerner (40's), shab suit, is squeezed in at a dice game. This is EAMES. He FIDDLES with his last two chips. COBB (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rub them against each other all you like, they're not going to breed. Eames looks up to see Cobb. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know. Eames tosses down his last chips. The dice are rolled... COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink? Eames loses. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're buying. Cobb follows Eames. Eames mysteriously produces two stack chips and puts them down in front of the cashier. Cobb pu one off the top, squints at the embossed name. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're spelling hasn't improved. Eames GRABS the chip. Hands it to the cashier. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss off. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your handwriting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames takes his money. Smiles at Cobb. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Versatile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames leads Cobb down the quiet street. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word is, you're not welcome in these parts. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a price on your head from Cobol Engineering. Pretty big one, actually. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't sell me out. Eames looks at Cobb, offended. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Course I would. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Not when you hear what I'm selling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ramshackle balcony overlooking a bust street. Eames pou COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inception. Eames's glass stops halfway to his mouth. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother telling me it's impossible. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfectly possible. Just bloody difficult. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I keep saying to Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: EAMES
dialogues.text: Arthur? You're still working with that stick-in-the-mud?

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: He's a good point man.

dialogues.speaker: EAMES
dialogues.text: The best. But he has no imagination. If you're going to perform inception, you need imagination.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: You've done it before?

dialogues.speaker: EAMES
dialogues.text: Yeas and no. We tried it. Got the idea in place, but it didn't take.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: You didn't plant it deep enough?

dialogues.speaker: EAMES
dialogues.text: It's not just about depth. You need the simplest version of the idea- the one that will grow naturally in the subject's mind. Subtle art.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: EAMES
dialogues.text: What's the idea you need to plant?

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: We want the heir to a major corporation to break up his father's empire.

dialogues.speaker: EAMES
dialogues.text: See, right there you've got various political motivations, anti- monopolistic sentiment and so forth. But all that stuff's at the mercy of the subject's prejudice- you have to go to the basic.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: EAMES
dialogues.text: The relationship with the father. (downs drink) Do you have a chemist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb shakes his head. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a man here. Yusuf. He formulates his own versions of the compounds. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go see him. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you've lost your tail. (Cobb reacts) Back by the bar, blue tie. Came in about two minutes after we did. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobol Engineering? EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pretty much own Mombasa. Cobb glances over the balcony. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run interference. We'll meet downstairs in half an hour. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back here? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last place they'd expect. Eames downs his drink. Rises. Walks over to the Businessm EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy! The Businessman looks up, awkward. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy Simmonds, it is you! Cobb nonchalantly SLIPS over the balcony DROPPING HARD in the midst of the crowd on the street below. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks harder) Oh. No, it isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb stands up, PUSHES into the crowd- faces PEER at him- moves, trying to blend- TURNS- a SECOND BUSINESS MAN is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disarming smile) Yes? SECOND BUSINESSMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to- Cobb HEAD BUTTS the Second Businessman, PUSHES past him- The First Businessman races out of the bar, sees Cobb's w DIVES after him- Cobb RACES headlong through tight passageways, WEAVING through or KNOCKING into the locals. He steps into a dark, crowded cafe, scanning the tables.. the First Businessman enters, spots him. An AFRICAN MAN g in Cobb's face, jabbering at him in Swahili- Cobb conside his options... the First Businessman DRAWS A GUN- Cobb bo steps up on a table and out an open window, SCRAMBLING in the alley outside... Cobb LOOKS left, right... CUTS LEFT into a narrow, CROWDE alley- the alley NARROWS TO A DEAD END. Faces in the CROW start to watch Cobb- PEOPLE start to SURROUND him- Cobb l back the way he came- the two Businessmen are there, GUNS

dialogues.speaker: DRAWN-
dialogues.text: Cobb sees a SMALL GAP between the buildings at the narrow he THROWS himself into it- gets STUCK HALFWAY... The crowd bears down, GRABBING for him as Cobb struggles SQUEEZE HIMSELF through the gap... Cobb's moving INCHES a his pursuers gain YARDS... the Crowd is upon him... he BU FREE. TUMBLING onto the next street, ROLLING out of sight Cobb Jumps to his feet- in a market square. TWO MORE BUSINESSMEN move towards him. Cobb BOLTS but a CAR SKIDS BLOCKS HIS PATH- the door opens- SAITO IS IN THE BACK. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care for a lift, Mr. Cobb? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping in) What brings you to Mombasa, Mr. Saito? SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to protect my investment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames stands on the pavement. The car pulls up. Cobb beck from the rear window. Eames looks at Saito. Back to Cobb. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your idea of losing a tail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Different tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur sits at the table, working on a mechanism. A small COUGH prompts him to look up: Ariadne is there. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said you'd be back. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried not to come. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's nothing else quite like it. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No paper, no pens... nothing between you and raw, direct creation. Arthur picks up his mechanism. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we take a look at paradoxical architecture? Ariadne nods, takes off her coat and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur leads Ariadne down some busy steps in a large glas and steel ATRIUM in an office complex. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to master a few tricks if you're going to build three complete dream levels. A SECRETARY DROPS some papers as they pass... ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of tricks? They take a tight turn and continue down the next flight. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a dream, you can cheat architecture into impossible shapes. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lets you create closed loops, like the Penrose Steps. The infinite staircase. Ariadne FREEZES- THEY ARE IN THE EXACT SPOT THEY STARTED DESCENDING FROM, next to the Secretary gathering her pape Ariadne puzzles at the impossible construction of the sta ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See... Arthur stops her gently- they are on the highest step, wi LARGE DROP to the next step. Arthur gestures at the drop. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paradox. A closed loop like this helps you disguise the boundaries of the dream you've created. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big do the levels have to be? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything from the floor of a building, to an entire city. But it has to be complicated enough for us to hide from the projections. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A maze. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the better the maze- ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The longer we have before the projections catch us. Ariadne looks around. Sees people LOOKING at Arthur. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My subconscious seems polite enough. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait, they'll turn ugly. No one likes to see someone else messing around in their mind. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb can't build anymore, can he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if he can't, but he won't. He thinks it's safer if he doesn't know the layouts. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't tell me. I think it's Mal. I think she's getting stronger. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ex-wife? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not his ex. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still together? Arthur turns to Ariadne. Gentle. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, she's dead, Ariadne. What you see in there is just his projection of her. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was she like in real life? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) She was lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito deposits a FILE in front of Cobb: PHOTOS, DOCUMENTS Cobb runs through them, he passes them to Eames. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert Fischer, 32. Heir to the Fischer Morrow energy conglomerate. He's spent his whole life being groomed as successor-breaking up his father's empire will take a radical shift in his thinking. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem with Fischer? SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not your concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't the usual corporate espionage, Mr. Saito. This is inception. The seed of the idea we plant will grow in this man's mind. It'll change him. It might even come to define him. Saito looks at Cobb. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sources suggest you might not have always been so cautious. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you need new sources, Mr. Saito. Saito considers Cobb. Shrugs. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fischer Morrow has the regulators in their pockets. We're the last company standing between them and total energy dominance and we can no longer compete. Soon they'll control the energy supply of half the world. They'll be able to blackmail governments, dictate policy. In effect, they become a new superpower. The world needs Robert Fischer to change his mind. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where we come in. How's Robert Fischer's relationship to his father? SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumor is the relationship is complicated. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need more than rumor, Mr. Saito. Eames picks up a photo: a distinguished executive (68). EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get me access to him? Browning. Fischer senior's right- hand man. Fischer junior's godfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should be possible. If you can get the right references. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: References are something of a specialty for me, Mr. Saito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames leads Cobb and Saito down uneven steps to a doorway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeling paint, buzzing flies. They ascend to a dusty, wire-reinforced glass door which Eames pushes open-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Row upon row of wooden shelves holding hundreds of dusty glass bottles of all shapes and colors. At the far end, a portly 40-year-old man rises from behind his desk, beckon This is YUSUF. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, come. Eames shakes Yusuf's hand. Yusuf stops at Cobb. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes. Mr. Cobb. I've heard so very much about you. (indicates chairs) please. Yusuf chases a CAT off Saito's chair. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody cats. Yusuf moves to a shelf and runs his fingers over the glas bottles. None of them has a label. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work using Somnacin, I think, Mr. Cobb? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're well informed, Mr. Yusuf. Yusuf places a bottle on the desk in front of Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dubious) Somnacin? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) Yusuf's Somnacin. Yusuf pulls the stopper, holds it towards Cobb's nose. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As good as the real thing? Yusuf WHIPS the bottle away from Cobb, offended. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better. Yusuf holds the bottle to the light, marveling. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Binds the dreamers tight. Let's them dream as one. Makes it real. Of course, if you'd prefer, you could use Somnacin brand. If you could explain to the international control council what you wanted it for. Yusuf puts the bottle back onto the shelf. Sits. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are seeking a chemist? (Cobb nods) To formulate compounds for a job? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to come into the held with us. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rarely go into the held, Mr. Cobb. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need you there to tailor compounds to our particular requirements. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which are? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great depth. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dream within a dream? Two levels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not possible. That many dreams within dreams would be too unstable. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done it before. You just have to add a sedative. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A powerful sedative. How many team members? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six. (to Cobb) The only way to know you've done the job is if I go in with you. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no room for tourists on these jobs, Mr. Saito. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time, it would seem there is. Cobb looks at him, uneasy. Yusuf pulls out another bottle YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I use it every day. Yusuf hands it to Cobb, who considers the white liquid inside. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? Yusuf beckons them further into the pharmacy, to a METAL DOOR. He STOPS- second thoughts. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps... you will not want to see. Cobb motions to continue. Yusuf pulls out a large key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark room with ROWS of low COTS. Each with a sleeping occupant. Tubes connect their wrists. An ELDERLY BALD MAN watches over them. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (counting) Eighteen, twenty-all connected, bloody hell. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come every day. To share the dream. Yusuf nods at the Elderly Bald Man, who moves to the near bed. Reaches out to the OCCUPANT. Gives his face a FIRM S The sleeper does not even stir. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Very stable. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do they dream? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three, four hours. Every day. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long in dream time? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this compound... about forty hours. Each and every day. Saito surveys the room, appalled. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they do it? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him, Mr. Cobb. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a while... (looks at Saito) It becomes the only way you can dream. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still dream, Mr. Cobb? Cobb STARES at the sleepers. Uneasy. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come here every day to sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELDERLY BALD MAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Cobb turns to the Elderly Bald Man, who looks fondly at h dreamers. ELDERLY BALD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to be woken up... the dream has become their reality... The Elderly Bald Man pokes a crooked finger at Cobb's che ELDERLY BALD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who are you to say otherwise? Cobb STARES at the Elderly Bald Man. DISTURBED. Cobb turn Yusuf. TOSSES him the bottle. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see what you can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb is lying on an empty cot, asleep. Yusuf stands over As we move in on Cobb's SLEEPING FACE we hear the sound o FREIGHT TRAIN, BUILDING, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Cobb's face as he lies, EYES CLOSED, cheek press to a METAL RAIL- THE SOUND OF THE TRAIN IS DEAFENING- Cob BREATHING, BREATHING, BREATHING, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb's eyes open. Yusuf is watching him. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharp, no? Cobb nods. Gets to his feet, looking around-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb SPLASHES water on his face, breathing hard- INSERT C

dialogues.speaker: A CURTAIN BILLOWS. MAL TURNS TO US, HAIR BLOWING, SMILING
dialogues.text: Cobb fumbles in his pockets, pulls out his spinning top. tries to set it spinning on the back edge of the sink, bu FALLS to the floor and rolls towards the door- Saito is there. WATCHING Cobb. He looks down at the spinning top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything alright, Mr. Cobb? Cobb dries his face with a paper towel. Picks up his top. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a small BRASS CHESS PIECE. Ariadne tips it over. Frowning, she picks up a micro drill, peels back the felt the bottom and widens a hole in one side of its base. Tes the TIPPING POINT again. A NOISE makes her look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne comes into the main space. Someone is there, unpacking one of the MECHANISMS. Cobb. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're back. Cobb looks up with a start. Caught out. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going under on your own? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just-I need to test some things. I didn't realize anyone was here. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just working on my totem. Ariadne holds up the chess piece. Cobb reaches for it. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see- Ariadne SNAPS it out of his reach. Smiles. Cobb nods. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're learning. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an elegant solution to keeping track of reality. Your invention? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Mal's. Cobb pulls out his spinning top. Looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one was hers. She'd spin it in a dream and it would never topple. Just spin and spin... ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur told me she died. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
