dialogues.text: She did. How are the mazes coming? Ariadne indicates three large ARCHITECTURAL MODELS. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Each level relates to the part of the subject's subconscious we're trying to access. I'm making the bottom level a hospital, so that Fischer will bring his father there- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me. Remember, you only want the dreamer to know the layout. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that so important? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case one of us brings in part of our subconscious. You wouldn't want any projections knowing the layout. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you bring Mal in. Cobb says nothing. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't build yourself because if you know the maze, then she knows it. And she'd sabotage the operation. You can't keep her out, can you? Cobb says nothing. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do the others know? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to warn them if it's getting worse- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gentle) I didn't say it's getting worse. Look, Ariadne, I need them for this job. I need you for this job. Without your help, I'll never get back to my children. And that's all I can care about right now. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you go home, Cobb? Cobb looks at her, deciding what to say. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think I killed her. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did she die? Cobb thinks. INSERT CUT: Mal, wind BLOWING her hair, smiles at Cobb. N we see Cobb- SHAKING HIS HEAD, TEARS STREAMING, BEGGING- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not asking whether I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne, Arthur, Yusuf, Eames and Saito sit around the ro looking at FILES. Cobb presides. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mark is Robert Fischer, heir to the Australian energy conglomerate, Fischer Morrow. Cobb opens a large presentation pad. COBB (reads aloud)

dialogues.speaker: EMPIRE."
dialogues.text: Cobb turns to the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An idea Robert Fischer's conscious mind would never accept. We have to plant it deep in his subconscious. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How deep? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three levels down. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dream within a dream within a dream? Is that even possible? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It is. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, the subconscious motivates through emotion, not reason, so we have to translate the idea into an emotional concept. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you translate a business strategy into an emotion? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we have to figure out. Robert and his father have a tense relationship. Worse, even, than the gossip columns have suggested... EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you play on that? Suggest breaking up his father's company as a 'screw you' to the old man? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Positive emotion trumps negative emotion every time. We yearn for people to be reconciled, for catharsis. We need positive emotional logic. Eames thinks. Paces. Looking back at the board. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try this... "MY FATHER ACCEPTS THAT

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW IN HIS FOOTSTEPS."
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That might work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might? We'll have to do better than that. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the contribution, Arthur. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me for wanting a little specificity, Eames. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inception's not about specificity. When we get inside his head, we're going to have to work with what we find. Arthur shrugs, frustrated. And we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team are in the middle of a DESERTED intersection. Ariadne is showing Yusuf aspects of the geography. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could split the idea into emotional triggers, and use one on each level. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean? EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the top level, we open up his relationship with his father.... Say: "I WILL NOT FOLLOW IN MY FATHER'S FOOTSTEPS." Next level down we've accessed his ambition and self-esteem. We feed him: "I

dialogues.speaker: WILL CREATE SOMETHING MYSELF."
dialogues.text: Then, the bottom level, we bring out the emotional big guns... COBB

dialogues.speaker: HIM."
dialogues.text: EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could do it. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you produce these emotional triggers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forge each emotional concept in the style and manner of Peter Browning, a key figure in Fischer's emotional life. Two AFRICAN PEDESTRIANS wander into view. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are those yours? Eames shakes his head. Cobb turns to Yusuf. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yusuf? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. Sorry. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppress them. We don't bring our own projections into the dream-we let Fischer's subconscious supply the people. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito, when do I get to see Browning? SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fly out to Sydney on Tuesday. We've arranged for you to spend several days...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames sits in the crowded room. Boxes and files are piled high. Browning stands by a pair of double doors. SAITO (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as part of a consulting litigation team working for Browning. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not smelling settlement here-we take them down. LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Browning, Maurice Fischer's policy is always one of avoiding litigation- Browning turns to the lawyer. Calm, but POWERFUL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we relay your concerns directly to Maurice? Browning opens the doors to Maurice Fischer's inner offic Eames leans in to watch as Browning beckons the Lawyer in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is a MAKESHIFT HOSPITAL ROOM: a BED where the should be. Browning addresses a figure at the window. ROB FISCHER, 30'S, abstracted. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he? Fischer turns to Browning. Motions silence, as he glances his FATHER in the bed. Wheezing gently. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to bother him unnecessarily but I know he- FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert! I've told you to keep out the damn!- MAURICE LASHES OUT, KNOCKING things from his bedside tabl NURSE calms Maurice as Fischer crouches to retrieve a FRA PHOTOGRAPH. He looks at the photo through the broken glas YOUNG BOY holds a PINWHEEL CLEARLY MADE BY A CHILD (each the points is numbered in pen), his FATHER blows on it. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be a cherished memory of his- FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put it by his bed. He hasn't even noticed. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, we have to talk about a power of attorney. I know this is hard for you, but it's important that we start to think about the future- FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Uncle Peter. Browning looks at Fischer, considering. Biding his time. EAMES (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vultures are circling. The sicker Maurice Fischer becomes, the stronger Peter Browning becomes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames WATCHES Browning, STUDYING his every move .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames gestures at a mirror, as if offering to shake hands EAMES (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had time to learn Browning's physical presence and mannerisms... In the mirror: BROWNING GESTURES BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, in the dream, I can impersonate Browning and suggest the concepts to Fischer's conscious mind... (draws a diagram) Then we take Fischer down another level and his own subconscious feeds it right back to him. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) So he gives himself the idea. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely. That's the only way to make it stick. It has to seem self-generated. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames, I'm impressed. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your condescension, as always, is much appreciated, Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team sit on the steps of the large marble lobby, debating. Ariadne is showing Arthur the lobby. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not scheduled for surgery, no dental, nothing. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he had some knee thing? EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing they'd put him under for. Besides, we need a good ten hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney to Los Angeles. They turn to Saito. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hours and forty-five minutes-one of the longest flights in the world. He makes it every two weeks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fischer steps out of a black town car and walks across th tarmac towards a GULF STREAM JET, accompanied by two aide COBB (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely he flies private? SAITO (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if there were unexpected maintenance with his plane. Fischer is met at the steps by a DISTRAUGHT FLIGHT OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb chews this over. Arthur comes over. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd have to be a 747. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a 747 the pilots are up above, first class is in the nose so nobody walks through the cabin. We'd have to buyout the whole cabin, and the first class flight attendant- SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We bought the airline. Everyone turns to Saito. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seemed... neater. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neater, huh? (gets to his feet) Well, now we have ten uninterrupted hours. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ariadne) Nice lobby, by the way. And we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is back in the workshop, deep in discussion. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My question is how we go down three layers with enough stability. Three layers down a little turbulence is gonna translate into an earthquake. The dreams are gonna collapse with the slightest disturbance. Yusuf clears his throat. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sedation. For sleep stable enough to create three layers of dreaming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yusuf depresses a plunger. Arthur is SLEEPING in a chair. YUSUF (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will have to combine it with an extremely powerful sedative.... Eames SLAPS Arthur, HARD. Arthur does not stir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur unconsciously rubs his cheek. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The compound we'll be using to share the dream is an advanced Somnacin derivative. It creates a very clear connection between dreamers, whilst actually accelerating brain function.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buying us more time in each level. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brain function in the dream will be about twenty times normal. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YUSUF (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you go into a dream within that dream the effect is compounded. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three dreams... that's ten hours, times twenty, times twenty, times twenty... EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Math was never my strong suit. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's basically a week one layer down, six months two layers down- ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ten years in the third level. Who wants to spend ten years in a dream? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on the dream. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not going to take us long to crack Fischer open once we get going. We'll be out in a couple days, max. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get out once we've made the plant? (to Cobb) I hope you've got something a little more elegant in mind than shooting me in the head like last time. Arthur tilts back in his chair. Yusuf turns to Cobb. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kick. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a kick? Eames slips his foot under Arthur's chair leg. TIPS it- Arthur's legs SHOOT UP INSTINCTIVELY for balance- EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, Ariadne, would be a kick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That feeling of falling which snaps you awake. We use that to jolt ourselves awake once we're done. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how are we going to feel that through the sedation? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the clever part. I customize the sedative...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, Eames and Yusuf watch Arthur, ASLEEP, in a chair. YUSUF (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To leave inner ear function unimpaired... Yusuf, with a wicked grin, slowly TIPS Arthur's chair backwards... as he falls, Arthur's body JERKS, EYES OPENI just before he HITS the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur thinks, nodding slowly. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way, however deep the sleep, the sleeper will still feel falling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yusuf gleefully LEANS a SLEEPING ARTHUR to one side ... YUSUF (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or tipping... Arthur goes down with a CRASH, JERKING AWAKE-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur thinks this through. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even that won't cut through three layers of deep sleep. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trick is to devise a kick for each level, then synchronize them to get a snap that penetrates all three layers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur looks at Cobb, getting it. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can use the musical countdown to synchronize the different kicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne comes into the darkened main space. Cobb is lying one of the chairs, asleep. Plugged into the mechanism. Ariadne stands over him. Watching. She opens the case, PULLS one of the tubes, sits, checkin the dials as she injects the needle cap into her arm, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne ascends. She looks at the buttons. Spots the "B." elevator STOPS. She looks through the grill at-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne pulls back the grill and walks across the room, considering the dusty furnishings. At the window is a dol house, front slightly ajar. Ariadne opens it. Inside is a SAFE. She tries it. LOCKED. A NOISE STARTLES her- she tur looking through a doorway into another room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne looks into the room to see Cobb and Mal talking, arguing. A private moment. Mal brushes at Cobb's hair, tr to convince him. We hear snatches of conversation- MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember when you asked me to marry you? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you had a dream... COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That we'd grow old together. MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we can. You know how to find me... you know what you have to do. Cobb is shaking his head, gently. Mal looks into Cobb's e gentle, loving... Mal SPOTS Ariadne spying on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREEZES, staring, hostile. Cobb turns, sees Ariadne, move towards her, leaving Mal. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be in here. Cobb guides her back into the elevator. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to know what "tests" you need to do on your own every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb shuts the CAGE DOOR. Ariadne hits a button. The elev RISES. Through the GRILL Ariadne can see a BEACH stretchi off into the distance. The elevator stops. Mal sits on th sand. Beside her, the two children are crouched, away fro us, building a SANDCASTLE. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do this to yourself? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the only way I can still dream. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it so important to dream? Cobb stares at his family. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my dreams... we're still together. The kids, WITHOUT TURNING AROUND, jump up and RUN AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator descends. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But these aren't just dreams, are they? They're memories. You said never to use memories. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I shouldn't. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're keeping her alive. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't let her go. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. These are moments I regret. Moments I turned into dreams so I could change them. Ariadne's fingers move across the buttons- stop at the "B ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What've you got buried down there that you regret? Cobb pushes her hand away. Hits the third floor button. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one thing I need you to understand about me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne follows Cobb into the kitchen. A THIN MAN is ther standing by the table. He holds a FOLDED PIECE OF PAPER. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your house? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine and Mal's. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd already died. The Thin Man offers Cobb the piece of paper. A CHILD'S SH Cobb TURNS. Ariadne follows his gaze to the garden. A sma blonde boy faces away from them, crouched on his haunches look at something on the ground. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's James. My boy. He's found something. Maybe a worm. A slightly older girl RUNS into view. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's Philippa. She crouches beside the boy. Their FACES ARE AWAY FROM US They point and discuss whatever is on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought about calling out, so they'd turn and smile those incredible smiles... but I'm out of time- The Thin Man thrusts the paper into Cobb's hand. THIN MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now. Or never, Cobb. Cobb nods, turns from the window- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I panic that I'll always wish I'd seen them turn, that I can't waste this chance... Cobb TURNS BACK to call out- but the children RACE OFF... COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the moment's passed. And whatever I do, the dream's always the same... When I'm about to call... they run. Cobb watches them run off, calling for grandma, FACES UNS COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm going to see their faces again-I've got to get back here in the real world... Behind him, Ariadne SLAMS the grill shut. Cobb TURNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne hits the BASEMENT button. The elevator starts to DESCEND. ariadne STARES, fascinated as glimpses of floors slip past: Mal's childhood bedroom, a thundering wall of freight train... The elevator STOPS. Through the grill Ariadne sees a HOTEL SUITE. She pulls open the grill, ste cautiously out into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISHEVELED bedclothes, UPENDED room service table, STRAWBERRIES across the floor. A STRUGGLE. Ariadne steps forwards- SMASH- she looks down to see that she has kicke over a CHAMPAGNE FLUTE. Ariadne feels a draught. The CURT BILLOWS. MAL (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Ariadne TURNS. Mal is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is- MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are. What are you doing here? ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Trying to understand. MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you understand? Do you know what it is to be a lover? To be half of a whole? ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Mal moves slowly towards Ariadne... MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you a riddle. You're waiting for a train. A train that will take you far away. You know where you hope this train will take you, but you don't know for sure... Mal glides around Ariadne, looking her over. MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... it doesn't matter. How can it not matter to you where that train will take you? COBB (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you'll be together. Cobb is standing in the elevator. Mal nods. Looks at him. MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you bring her here, Dom? ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hotel. We spent our anniversaries in this suite. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened here? Mal picks up the BROKEN STEM of a champagne flute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb PULLS Ariadne into the elevator- Mal THROWS herself towards Ariadne- Cobb SLAMS the GRILL- Mal SMASHES agains AGAIN and AGAIN like a WILD ANIMAL- Ariadne FLINCHES- MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you PROMISED! YOU SAID WE'D BE

dialogues.speaker: TOGETHER
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can. We will. But I need you to stay here for now- MAL

dialogues.speaker: YOU SAID WE'D GROW OLD TOGETHER
dialogues.text: Cobb pushes a button and the elevator starts to rise. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come back. I need you to stay here on your own for now. Just while I do this job. Then we can be together- MAL

dialogues.speaker: WE'LL BE TOGETHER-YOU PROMISED
dialogues.text: Mal THROWS herself against the grill, and. we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne watches Cobb sleeping. His eyes gradually flicker open. He sees her watching him. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can just build a prison of memories to lock her in? You think that's going to contain her? The LIGHTS COME ON: Saito and Arthur stand in the doorway SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice Fischer just died in Sydney. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the funeral? SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thursday. In Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert'll accompany the body Tuesday at the outside. We have to move. Cobb gets up. Ariadne comes over to him. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) I'm coming with you. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I promised Miles. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team needs someone in there who understands what you're struggling with. If you don't want it to be me then you need to show Arthur what I just saw. Cobb looks at Ariadne. Turns to Saito. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need one more seat on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito stands looking out the window at a 747. Cobb arrive beside him. They watch a COFFIN being loaded. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I get on this plane and you haven't taken care of things... when we land I go to jail for the rest of my life. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complete the job en route, I make one phone call from the plane... you will have no trouble clearing immigration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The luxurious cabin has only ten seats. Cobb finds his- s Ariadne in the seat behind his. They do not acknowledge e other. Behind her is Arthur, looking out the window. Eame enters, STUFFS his bag into the overhead bin, BLOCKING th passenger behind: ROBERT FISCHER, standing there, patient bag in hand, wearing black. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames SQUEEZES up against his seat to let Fischer BRUSH P Fischer moves to his seat, directly in front of Cobb. Eam TOSSES Cobb a PASSPORT. Cobb flips it open: Fischer's. Pockets it. Yusuf and Saito enter, take their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 747 HURTLES down the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb looks down at his hand: a TINY VIAL taped to the cen of his palm. He removes the cap. The seatbelt sign goes d Cobb unbuckles, stands. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Fischer looks up. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is yours... Cobb holds up the open passport, comparing the picture to Fischer. Fischer's hand goes to his pocket. Cobb hands Fischer the passport. FLIGHT ATTENDANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you gentlemen care for a drink? FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same. Fischer gives Cobb a thin smile. Holds up his passport. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. Look, I couldn't help noticing your name. You're not related to Maurice Fischer? Fischer takes a beat. But Cobb seems harmless. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, he was my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry for your loss. He was an inspiring figure. The Flight Attendant brings their drinks- Cobb takes them COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. As he turns to Fischer he LOWERS his right hand ... a CLE LIQUID DROPS into Fischer's water as Cobb hands it to him COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Maurice Fischer. (they drink) I'll leave you in peace. Fischer grants him a smile.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 747
dialogues.text: The great plane SOARS through a burning cloudscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb reaches into the overhead for a blanket- lets it fal onto Fischer's head- Fischer doesn't flinch. ASLEEP. Cobb SIGNALS the others. The First Flight Attendant unlocks a CUPBOARD in the galley, then leaves, closing the curtain. Arthur moves into the galley and pulls out a MECHANISM CA Cobb and Arthur open the mechanism- uncoil the tubes- fee them around the window side of each of the seats. Arthur rolls up Fischer's cuff- PUSHES the needle cap into Fisch wrist. Arthur pulls Fischer's cuff down and hides the tub behind the armrest of Fischer's seat. Arthur runs the next tube to Ariadne. Cobb puts the case Yusuf's lap. Yusuf checks the TIMERS, tapping the syringe The others recline their seats. Yusuf HITS A BUTTON- clos the case- places it at his feet. He settles back, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb DRIVES. Saito and Arthur are in the back. Rain BEATS down. Cobb pulls over-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yusuf stands on the corner, silver briefcase in hand, col turned up against the rain. He reaches for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yusuf clambers into the back, brushing rain from his face ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates rain) Couldn't you have peed before you went under? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. The front door OPENS and Eames climbs in, soaked. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bit too much free champagne before takeoff, Yusuf? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha bloody ha. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least we know he'll be looking for a cab in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb pulls out into the heavy traffic. He weaves around several cars before lining up behind a YELLOW CAB. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brace yourselves. Cobb hits the gas- REAR ENDS the cab with a CRUNCH. The CABDRIVER gets out, fuming. Heads to Cobb's window- CABDRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, asshole! Why don't you try driving without your thumb up- He sees the SILENCED PISTOL Cobb is holding at his belly. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk away. The Cabdriver backs off. Arthur climbs into the cab. Both cars pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur SLOWS in front of the TRAIN STATION, peering at th pedes pedestrians. He SPOTS Fischer, lights the cab's sig Fischer FLAGS him down. Fischer JUMPS into the back, brus rain from his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third and Market. Snappy. Eames JUMPS in from the other side. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing? EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I thought it was free. Maybe we could share. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not. Saito gets into the front passenger seat. Pointing a gun. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Arthur pulls away. Fischer pulls out his wallet and tosse at Eames. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contemptuous) There's 500 dollars in there. And the wallet's worth more than that. For that you ought to at least drop me at my stop. Eames smiles at this. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid- A SHOT SHATTERS the window by Eames's head- another SHOT IMPACTS by Saito- EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us out of here! Arthur hits the gas, but a BLACK S.U.V. SKIDS sideways in front, BLOCKING the path- A BLOCK BEHIND- Cobb is at a light. ARIADNE is getting in front. Cobb has HEARD the GUNFIRE- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!- Cobb looks ahead to the AMBUSH, hits the gas- the sedan ROCKETS forwards... but BAM- A FREIGHT TRAIN CLIPS THE FR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECOND S.U.V. is behind the cab- PLAIN CLOTHES SECURITY advance through the traffic, weapons trained on the cab. Bullets RIP into the cab as Eames throws himself on top o Fischer, PULLING a SACK over his head- Inside the sedan, Ariadne watches the train passing- ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't in the design- Cobb BACKS UP, SPINS around, heading for the tail of the train- A Security Man emerges from the front S.U.V. carrying an AUTOMATIC RIFLE- he steps towards the cab through the rai raises his weapon and BLASTS THE CAB'S WINDSCREEN- Cobb clears the end of the train, and SKIDS across the tr Arthur CROUCHES down- PUSHES the accelerator with his HAN YANKS the wheel- FLYING BLIND. The cab NAILS the Security Man, CRUNCHING into the front S.U.V.- Cobb SMASHES his car into the rear S.U.V., creating a GAP Arthur YANKS the transmission and REVERSES- SCRAPING thro the gap- Security Men DIVE out of the way- Arthur throws ragged J-turn to head down a SIDE STREET- Cobb follows in other car. Rain whips across Arthur's face as he BREATHES ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody okay? Saito? Arthur looks at Saito. Saito's hand is at his belly. Cove in BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sedan and cab pull into the side entrance- Eames jump out- PULLS the shutter down behind them-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yusuf and Eames PULL Fischer from the cab, HUSTLING him through a doorway. Cobb JUMPS out of the sedan, furious. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur! Arthur what the- Arthur pulls the bloody Saito from the front seat. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ. Is he dying?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: I don't know. What happened back there? Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: We were blocked by a freight train.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: (to Ariadne) Why would you put a train crossing in a downtown intersection?

dialogues.speaker: ARIADNE
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: (snaps) Why were we all ambushed, Arthur?! Those weren't regular projections- they'd been trained!

dialogues.speaker: ARIADNE
dialogues.text: How could they be trained?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Fischer's had an extractor teach his mind to defend itself. His subconscious is militarized. It should've shown on the research-

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: So why the hell didn't it?!

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: Don't tell me to calm down-you were meant to check Fischer's background thoroughly. You can't make this kind of mistake-we're not prepared for this kind of violence-

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR
dialogues.text: Cobb, we've dealt with sub-security before. We just have to be more-

dialogues.speaker: COBB
dialogues.text: This wasn't part of the plan, Arthur! (points at Saito) He's dying!

dialogues.speaker: EAMES
dialogues.text: So we put him out of his misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames steps into the room, pulls his gun and moves over Saito. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in agony. Let's wake him up- Cobb GRABS Eames's arm. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (they lock eyes) It won't wake him up. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, it won't wake him? When you die in a dream you wake up. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from this. We're too heavily sedated to wake up that way. Eames looks at Yusuf, then to Cobb. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happens if one of us dies? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That person doesn't wake up. Their mind drops into Limbo. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limbo? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unconstructed dream space. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's down there? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raw, infinite subconscious. Nothing there but what was left behind by anyone on the team who's been trapped there before. On this team... just Cobb. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long would we be stuck there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't even think about trying to escape until the sedation eases- EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decades-it could be infinite-I don't know! Ask him-he's the one who's been there before! Eames moves to Cobb. Looks him in the eye. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. So now we're stuck in Fischer's mind battling it out with his private army, and if we get hit we're stuck in Limbo 'til our brains dissolve into scrambled egg? Cobb says nothing. Saito groans more loudly. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just get him upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito is laid out on an old desk. Arthur examines him. He motions to Ariadne. Eames watches Cobb. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this. Firm pressure. Arthur turns to Cobb. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew the risks and you didn't tell us. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There wasn't meant to be any risk. We weren't supposed to be dealing with a load of gunnre. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had no right. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way you can go three layers deep, Arthur. Arthur turns to Yusuf, hostile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you. You went along with this? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trusted him. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You trusted him? When? When he promised you half his share? YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offended) No! His whole share. Plus, he told me he'd done it before. Arthur turns to Cobb. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? With Mal? That worked out great, didn't it, Cobb? Cobb grabs Arthur. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know anything about that. This was the only way to do this job, Arthur. I did what I had to do to get back to my children. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you led us into a war zone with no way out. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a way out. The kick. We just have to push on, do the job as fast as possible and get out using the kick. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. We go any deeper, we just raise the stakes. I'm sitting it out on this level. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never make it, Eames. Fischer's security is surrounding this place as we speak. The ten hours of the flight is a week at this level-you'll never make it without getting killed. Downwards is the only way forwards. We have to carry on. Saito groans. Cobb looks at him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we have to do it fast. Eames and Arthur weigh this. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames, go get ready. Arthur, let's get in there and soften him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb and Arthur, wearing BALACLAVAS, PULL the sack from Fischer's head. He is chained to the radiator. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm insured against kidnapping up to ten million-this'll be simple- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it won't. Fischer looks at Cobb, unnerved. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In. your lather's office, below the bookshelves, is his personal safe. We need the combination. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never noticed a safe- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean you don't know the combination. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have it on good authority that you do. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yusuf looks through Fischer's wallet. Eames is opening a HINGED, THREE-WING MIRROR. YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred dollars, this cost? EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash, cards, ID... and this- Yusuf holds up a SNAPSHOT: the photo from Maurice Fischer office- YOUNG ROBERT holds his HOMEMADE PINWHEEL, his FAT blows on it. Eames takes it from Yusuf. STUDIES it. Cobb enters. Eames hands him the snapshot. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Useful? Cobb studies the snapshot. Eames examines himself in the hinged mirror from multiple angles: ONE BY ONE the myriad Eames reflections BECOME BROWNINGS. Cobb pockets the phot COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on. You've got an hour. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour? I was supposed to have all night to crack him. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Saito was supposed to keep his guts on the inside. You've got an hour-get something we can use. Eames turns from the mirror AS BROWNING. He glances at hi watch, then SCREAMS, as if begging for mercy-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Browning's CRY reverberates- Fischer looks up, concerned- FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good authority. Another cry rings out. Fischer recognizes the voice. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Peter?! Make them stop- ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The combination. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know it! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would Browning tell us you did? FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to him-I'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb pushes Browning (Eames), bloody and bruised, into th room and forces him down next to Fischer. Cobb handcuffs Browning's wrist to a metal bracket on the side of the si COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got an hour. Get talking. Cobb leaves. BROWNING (EAMES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've had me for two days. They've got someone with access to your father's office and they're trying to open his safe-they thought I'd know the combination, but I don't- FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I, Uncle Peter. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Maurice told me that after he passed only you would be able to open it. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never gave me the combination. Browning thinks for a minute. Realizes something. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did, he just didn't tell you that it was a combination. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, then? BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something only you would know. Some meaningful combination of numbers from your experiences with Maurice- FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't have a lot of meaningful experiences together. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps after your mother died... FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After my mother died, I went to him in my grief. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FISCHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what he told me? "There's really nothing to be said, Robert." BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He always had a hard time with emotional- FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was eleven, Uncle Peter. Browning (Eames) takes this in. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loved you, Robert. In his way. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "In his way?" At the end he called me to his deathbed. He could barely speak, but he took the trouble to say one last thing to me. He pulled me close... I could make out only one word. "Disappointed." Browning can say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb pulls off his balaclava. Looks down at Saito, who is breathing fast, shallow. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing? ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in a lot of pain. Cobb takes Saito's hand. Looks him in the eye. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we get you down to the next level, the pain will be less intense. Saito nods, breathing hard. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) And if he dies? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His conscious mind will drop out of the dream. He'll be trapped in Limbo for a lifetime... ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will that do to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb looks at her. Grave. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he wakes... his mind could be completely gone. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When... when we wake I will still honor our arrangement... Cobb looks down at Saito sadly. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito-san, when you wake you might not even remember that we had an arrangement. You'll have forgotten this world. Limbo will be your reality. Lost there so long, you'll have become an old man... SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with regret? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting to die alone. Yes. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll take the chance and come back. And we'll be young men together again. Saito smiles weakly. Cobb nods at him, turns to Ariadne. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When were you trapped in Limbo? Cobb says nothing. Ariadne pulls him away from Saito. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, you might have convinced the rest of this team to carry on with the job. But they don't know the truth. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What truth? ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth that at any minute you might bring a freight train through the wall. The truth that Mal is bursting up through your subconscious. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth that as we go deeper into Fischer, we're also going deeper into you-and I'm not sure we're going to like what we find there. Cobb stares back at Ariadne. Saying nothing. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not just about Fischer, it's about you. Tell me what happened to you and Mal. Trapped in Limbo. Cobb looks at her. Thinking it through. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were on a job. Exploring dreams within dreams. But we didn't understand how your mind can turn hours into years. How you can get trapped. Trapped so deep that when you wash up on the shore of your subconscious...

dialogues.speaker: SKY, WAVES WASHING OVER HER...
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can lose track of what's real. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you stuck? Cobb pauses before he answers. Looks at Ariadne. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty years. Ariadne stares at him, incredulous. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you stand it? INSERT CUT: COBB AND MAL BUILD A SANDCASTLE ON THE BEACH. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We built. We created a whole world for ourselves... INSERT CUT: COBB AND MAL WALK THROUGH A DESERTED CITY. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so bad at first, being gods. The problem is knowing that it's not real. It became impossible for me to live like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not for her? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She accepted it. At some point...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal opens a DOLL'S HOUSE. Inside is a SAFE. She opens it- is empty. She pulls out her SPINNING TOP. COBB (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she'd decided to forget that our world wasn't real. Mal places the top inside the safe. LOCKS IT AWAY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you finally woke up? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To wake from that. From decades lived. To be old souls thrown back into youth. It was hard. At first Mal seemed okay. But I started to realize something was wrong. Finally she admitted it. This idea she was possessed by. This simple little idea that changed everything... ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That our world was not real. No matter what I did, no matter what I said, she was convinced that we were still in a dream. That we needed to wake up again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb is trying to calm Mal, who is hysterical. COBB (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That to get home we'd have to kill ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne looks at Cobb, appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your children? Cobb has to look away. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She... she believed they weren't real. That our real children were waiting. Somewhere above...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal shakes her head at Cobb as he USHERS the children out the room, FACES UNSEEN- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Mal- MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're projections, Dom. Your dreams. I'm their mother-don't you think I can tell the difference? Cobb closes the door- turns to her, eyes full of bitter tears. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's my dream then why can't I control it? Why can't I stop this? MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it's obvious) You don't know you're dreaming. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep telling me I am- MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't believe me! COBB (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was certain. But she loved me too much to go without me. So she made a plan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb walks along, checking door numbers against a key. COBB (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For our anniversary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb enters the lavish suite. He notices the DISHEVELED BEDCLOTHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps forwards- SMASH- he has tipped over a champagne glass with his foot... dinner for two is SPREAD ACROSS TH FLOOR. He looks at the DEBRIS, confused... next to the br glass is a SPINNING TOP. He picks it up, studying it, thinking. He feels a draught, looks to the window. The CURTAIN BILLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb looks out the window: Mal sits on the ledge of the opposite window. HAIR BLOWING. Feet dangling over the dizzyingly high atrium. She smiles. MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join me. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal, come back inside. MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm going to jump. And you're coming with me. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. This is real-if you jump, you're not going to wake up, you're going to die. Let's go back inside and talk about this, please. MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've talked enough. She KICKS off a shoe and watches it DROP. MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come out onto the ledge or I'll jump right now. She means it. Cobb swings his legs out, sitting on the le opposite is wife. He looks down at the drop. MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking you to take a leap of faith. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that, Mal. I can't leave our children. MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I go without you, they'll take them away, anyway. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I filed a letter with our attorney. Explaining how I'm fearful for my safety, how you've threatened to kill me... Cobb looks back at the wrecked hotel suite, PANICKING... MAL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Dom. I've freed you from the guilt of choosing to leave them. We're going home to our real children. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out children are here, Mal. Mal CLOSES HER EYES. Cobb looks for some way to reach her MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're waiting for a train... COBB

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A train that will take you far away... COBB

dialogues.speaker: DON'T DO THIS
dialogues.text: MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where you hope this train will take you, you can't know for sure... COBB

dialogues.speaker: DON'T
dialogues.text: MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it doesn't matter... COBB

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: MAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you'll be together... Mal SLIPS FORWARD INTO SPACE. Cobb SCREAMS after her. The tries to bury his face in the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb stares as he remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He letter to the authorities refuted all the claims about her sanity that she knew I'd make...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb stands with the Thin Man, who has a piece of paper. COBB (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd had herself declared sane by three different psychiatrists. Cobb hears a SHOUT- turns to the garden. James CROUCHES, Philippa joins him, examining the ground, FACES UNSEEN... COBB (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was impossible for me to explain the nature of her madness... The Thin Man thrusts the paper into Cobb's hand. THIN MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now. Or never, Cobb. Cobb turns back to the window- about to call out- James a Philippa RUN OFF. Cobb turns from the window. Looks at th paper in his hand. It is an AIRPLANE TICKET. COBB (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I ran. And I've been running ever since, trying to buy my way back to my family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb looks across at Ariadne. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychiatrists judged her sane? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was sane. She was just lost in the labyrinth. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why should you blame yourself? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we were a family. And we had a life I would do anything to get back to now. But that reality wasn't enough for me then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might have been your idea to push the limits, Cobb. But you're not responsible for the idea that destroyed her. The idea that her world wasn't real... that was her own idea from her own mind. Cobb says nothing. ARIADNE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your guilt defines her. Powers her. If we're going to succeed in this, you're going to have to forgive yourself, and you're going to have to confront her. But you don't have to do it alone. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this for me- ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing it for the others. They don't know the risk they've taken coming in here with you. Cobb looks at the rooftop opposite, sees a SNIPER take up position. Cobb shakes his head, frustrated. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't stay here. Arthur?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Browning puts his hand on Fischer's shoulder. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people are going to kill us if we don't give them the combination. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't, they'll try to ransom us- BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard them-they're going to lock us in and run the can into the river. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is in the safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something for you. Maurice always said it was his most previous gift... a will. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice's will is with Port and Dunn. BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an alternate. It supersedes the other only if you want it to. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it say? BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It splits all the component businesses of Fischer Morrow into individual companies, transferring ownership to the boards of those companies... FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving me nothing? BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A basic living. Nothing more. The entire empire would cease to exist. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destroy my own inheritance? Why would he suggest such a thing? BROWNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Robert. Cobb OPENS the door. Arthur is behind him. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to your senses? FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us go. I don't know the combination. Not consciously. Cobb considers this. Opens his phone. Pulls out his gun. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try instinctively. I have someone standing in your father's office ready to tap in a combination. He holds the phone to Fischer's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First six numbers that come into your head. Right now. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea- Cobb SWINGS the gun onto Browning- COBB

dialogues.speaker: RIGHT NOW
dialogues.text: FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five, two, eight... four, nine, one. Cobb lowers his weapon. Listens to the phone. Shakes his head. Shuts the phone. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to do better. Bag `em. Arthur puts SACKS over their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb and Arthur drag Fischer and Browning to the van- FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're worth much more to you alive... Arthur places Fischer on the back seat- uses a DROPPER to drop LIQUID onto Fischer's mask- his head SLUMPS FORWARDS "Browning" yanks the sack from his head- it is now EAMES. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) His relationship with his father's much worse that we thought. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That helps us? Arthur pulls a SNIPER RIFLE from a case by the van. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stronger the issues, the more powerful the catharsis. Cobb motions for Yusuf to follow his upstairs. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how do you reconcile them if they're that estranged?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on that. Arthur lines up a shot through the window- ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, work fast-Fischer's projections are closing in quick, we need to break out of here before we're totally boxed in... Arthur SHOOTS two snipers. Cobb and Yusuf gently load Sai into the van. He groans. Ariadne straps him in, checks hi bandages. Arthur can't get the last sniper- he's too hidd behind a wall- EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't be afraid to dream a little bigger, Arthur- Eames lines up a shot with a grenade launcher. Fires- the sniper EXPLODES into the air- Arthur looks at Eames. EAMES (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we? They climb into the van-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls out into the rain-drenched streets. Arthur opens the mechanism case and hands out tubes- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shifting Fischer's antipathy from his father onto Browning should work. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need the imagery, the words... ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you destroy his one positive relationship? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We repair his relationship with his father and expose his godfather's true nature. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, we should be charging Fischer as much as Saito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about his security? It's going to get worse as we go deeper. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We bring in Mr. Charles. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Mr. Charles? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bad idea. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur, the second we approach Fischer in that hotel, they're gonna mow us down-we run with Mr. Charles like on the Stein job. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've done it before? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. But it didn't work. The subject realized he was dreaming and his subconscious tore us to pieces. Eames takes this in. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You learned a lot, though. Right? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eames) I'll need a decoy. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. How about a pretty young lady I've used before? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine- Cobb looks back: a second S.U.V. pulls out, tailing them. COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Yusuf) I know you've got to stay ahead of them, but drive with kid gloves, okay? The world down there is going to be very unstable-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't make the jump too soon- that kick is our only way back, we have to be ready to catch it- YUSUF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll use the music to let you know when it's coming, but the rest is up to you. Arthur puts the mechanism onto the front seat. YUSUF (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone ready? Nods all round. YUSUF (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams- Yusuf hits a button and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fischer nurses a drink. Staring at the ice cracking. BLONDE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I boring you? Fischer looks up. A beautiful BLONDE is next to him. BLONDE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was telling you my story. I guess it wasn't to your liking. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a lot on my mind. Fischer looks around the bar. There are several STERN-LOO CHARACTERS paying him too much attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Ariadne sit at a table across the lobby. They Cobb moving across the lobby towards Fischer. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there goes Mr. Charles. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who or what, exactly, is Mr. Charles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a gambit designed to turn Fischer against his own subconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb approaches the bar, watched closely by Fischer's Sub security. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fishcer! Good to see you again. Rod Green, Marketing. (to Blonde) And you must be... BLONDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving. She presses against Fischer as she slides off her stool a deposits a cocktail napkin in front of him. BLONDE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you get bored. Cobb watches her walk away. The Sub-security FOLLOWS her. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you just got blown off... unless her phone number really does have only six digits. Fischer glances at the napkin: "528-491."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur watches the Sub-security follow the Blonde. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why don't you approve? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it involves telling the mark that he's dreaming. Which involves attracting a lot of attention to us. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't Cobb say never to do that? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must've noticed by now how much time Cobb spends doing things he says never to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb turns to Fischer. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange way to make friends. (off look) Lifting your wallet, I mean. Fischer pats his pocket. Empty. He looks to the lobby whe he sees the Sub-security trailing the Blonde. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it. The wallet alone's worth- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred bucks. I know. Don't worry, my guys are on it. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did you say you were? Fischer looks at him, curious. Cobb plows on, confident- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I was Rod Green from Marketing-but I'm not. My name is Mr. Charles. I might seem familiar to you. I'm in charge of your security here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blonde hurries up to Saito, emerging from the elevato BLONDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Saito, can I have a minute? She pushes him back into the elevator, closing the door a the Sub-security approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blonde fondles Saito's lapels, getting close. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but... Saito glances over her shoulder to see, in the tunnel of infinite reflections created by the elevator's opposing mirrors, three reflections in, THE BLONDE IS EAMES. He wi SAITO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him away) Very amusing, Mr. Eames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look a bit perkier. A SHUDDER ripples through the elevator. SAITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turbulence on the plane. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels closer. That's Yusuf's driving. And we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yusuf FIGHTS the wheel as the van CUTS DOWN AN ALLEY, BUM OVER POTHOLES and SMASHING TRASH CANS aside- THREE S.U.V. FURIOUS PURSUIT. Yusuf looks in the rear view mirror, FRUSTRATED. He checks his WATCH, then checks the back: th SLEEPERS SHAKE with the impact and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a TREMOR echoes through the bar Fischer looks at Cobb trying to place him. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security? You work for the hotel? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. My specialty is subconscious security. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about dreams. You're talking about extraction. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. My job is to protect you... Behind Fischer a WAITER puts down a tray- tipping a champ glass over- SMASH- Cobb NOTICES. Pauses, looks across the HIS TWO CHILDREN ARE CROUCHED, BACKS TOWARDS US... Cobb looks around the bar, the patrons start to STARE at Cobb, suspicious- Cobb shifts back to Fischer-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job is to protect you from any attempt to access your mind through your dreams. Cobb regains his patter- the patrons lose interest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eames pulls out Fischer's wallet, moves to hand it to Sai then PAUSES, opens it, leafs past the cast to find... The SNAPSHOT: young Robert holding his HOMEMADE PINWHEEL, his father blowing on it. The elevator doors open and Eames s off. HANDS Saito the wallet. EAMES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off at a different floor and keep moving. Dump the wallet, then meet me in the lobby. The security will try to track it down. We need to buy Cobb a little more time. The doors close. Saito puts the wallet in his pocket. He COUGHS- a deep, nasty cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb looks over Fischer's shoulder to see a SUITED MAN watching him. Another MAN is walking in from the lobby. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not safe here. Cobb steps away from the bar. Fischer does not move. COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. They're coming for you. Fischer sizes him up, A CLAP OF THUNDER ECHOES, and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNSHOTS BLAST out the rear and side windows of the van- Security Man is leaning out of the lead S.U.V. With a SHO WIND AND RAIN RIP THROUGH THE VAN- in the back, ARTHUR'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fischer looks out the windows at sudden, HURRICANE-LIKE R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange weather, huh? A TREMOR runs through the bar- Cobb looks around- COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariadne and Arthur watch the GUSTS OF WIND RATTLE the windows. Arthur sees HOTEL GUESTS staring out at the weat PUZZLED. Several of them TURN TO LOOK DIRECTLY AT ARTHUR. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb's drawing Fischer's attention to the strangeness of the dream. That's making his subconscious look for the dreamer. For me. And we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the alley-   Yusuf THROWS the van into a HA RIGHT TURN- we move into   EXTREME SLOW MOTION... THE SLE

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK ARE DRAWN TO ONE SIDE OF THE VAN BY THE
dialogues.text: CENTRIFUGAL FORCE... and   we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The liquid in Fischer's drink RISES UP AGAINST ONE SIDE O THE GLASS- Fischer notices, confused. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very odd-the weather, the gravity... Fischer looks around the bar- it's as if THE ENTIRE ROOM SET AT A 45-DEGREE ANGLE- glasses SLIDING off tables... COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can explain all this. You've actually been trained for this. (Fischer nods) Think of the strangeness of the weather, the shifts in gravity. None of this is real... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) We're in a dream. Fischer looks at the room around them. Back to Cobb. All through the bar, patrons turn to look at Cobb IN UNISON. COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The simplest test of what I'm saying is for you to try and remember anything about the way you arrived in this hotel... okay? Fischer stares at Cobb, trying to process this. All aroun them, people STARE at Cobb. Several get up as if to appro COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe. Remember the training. Accept the fact that we're in a dream. That's why I'm here protecting you. As Fischer considers this we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yusuf STRAIGHTENS UP the van, RACING down the street, swerving through traffic and we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building gradually EASES BACK INTO ALIGNMENT- FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you... you're not real? The bar patrons start to ignore Cobb again. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm a projection of your subconscious. I was put in place to protect you in the event that extractors pulled you into a dream. I believe that's what has happened. Fischer takes this in. Then looks at the Security Men approaching across the crooked floor, he nods at Cobb-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb escorts Fischer across the lobby. As he does so, he walks past the two CHILDREN, backs to us- Cobb ignores th The two Sub-security fall in behind. Cobb hurries Fischer the stairs- then PUSHES him into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fischer stumbles in- turns to Cobb, angry- FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey- Cobb reaches into his jacket- the First Man BURSTS in- Co KICKS him to the ground- DRAWS his gun as the SECOND MAN comes through the door, moving towards Fischer- BLAM! Cobb BLASTS the Second Man in the back- TURNS and SHOOTS the First Man. FISCHER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! What are you doing?! Cobb turns to Fischer, calm. Convincing. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the gun in his hand. Fischer looks: the Second Man was holding a pistol. Cobb opens the First Man's jacket to show Fischer his holster sidearm. COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These men were sent to abduct you. Cobb pulls out the gun and HANDS it to Fischer. COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm going to help you, I need you to be calm. Fischer remembers something. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is a dream, I have to kill myself and wake up- Fischer raises the gun towards his head- COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that-they've probably got you sedated. If you pull that trigger, you might not wake up, you might drop into a lower dream state. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fischer, you know all this, you just have to remember it... Fischer lowers his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saito walks down the corridor, followed by a Security Man Saito DUCKS around the corner, moves to a GARBAGE CHUTE a DROPS Fischer's WALLET into it. He SLIPS into the stairwe as the Security Man comes abreast of the chute and pauses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur leads Ariadne to a particular room: 491.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur leads Ariadne in. He opens the closet, opens the r safe, pulls our FOUR BRICKS OF PLASTIC EXPLOSIVE. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, if everything's correct, this room should be directly below 528.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb looks reassuringly at Fischer. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you remember from before this dream? FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) Rain... gunfire... Uncle Peter. (looks up) Christ-we've been kidnapped. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were they holding you? FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had us... in the back of a van... COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your body's bouncing around in the back of a van right now-that explains the gravity shifts. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was... to do with a safe... Christ, why's it so hard to remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like trying to remember a dream after you've woken up. It takes years of practice to do it easily. So, you and Browning have been pulled into this dream so they can steal something from your mind. What? FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wanted a combination to a safe... they demanded the first numbers to pop into my head. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's them extracting a locator. FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A locator? COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number from your own subconscious. It can be used any number of ways... (thinking) This is a hotel. Room numbers. What was the number you gave them? FISCHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5, 2... something... it was a long number. 528... 528, 4 something. COBB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opens phone) Well, we know where to start. (into phone) Fifth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur hangs up the phone. He is standing on a chair, attaching the explosives to the ceiling. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you use a timer? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I have to judge it myself. Once you're all asleep up in room 528, I wait `til Yusuf starts his kick... ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His music warns me it's coming, then the van hitting the barrier of the bridge should be unmistakable- that's when I blow the floor out from underneath us and we get a nice synchronized kick. Too soon, and we won't get pulled out; too late and I won't be able to drop us. ARIADNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
